intro: Juglans sigillata, commonly known as Chinese black walnut, is a deciduous tree native to eastern Asia. It is characterized by its compound leaves with 15–23 leaflets and its distinctive, dark green, heart-shaped leaves. The tree produces small, yellowish-green flowers and spherical, green fruits that turn dark brown when mature. Its wood is highly valued for its strength and fine grain, making it useful in furniture and tool-making. The plant also has medicinal uses in traditional Chinese medicine.
